p: The leaves of samples were collected in Sardinia between March and October of 2010 by Dr. Alessandra Piras. A voucher specimen of the plants is kept at the Department of Chemical and Geological Sciences, University of Cagliari (Italy). Before utilization, plant materials were air-dried and were ground with a Malavasi mill (Bologna, Italy). Isolation of essential oils by hydrodistillation was performed in a Clevenger-type apparatus for 4 h [ 37]. The essential oils were stored at 4 Â°C in the dark until the chemical analyses.
